casebody.data:
Donna B. BRADLEY, Employee, Plaintiff
v.
MISSION ST. JOSEPH'S HEALTH SYSTEM, Employer and
Cambridge Integrated Services Group, Inc., Third Party Administrators, Defendants. No. 25PA07. Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 3, 2007. Allan R. Tarleton, Asheville, for Mission Hospitals, Inc. David Gantt, Asheville, for Bradley.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 22nd day of January 2007 by Defendant (Health System) in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 3rd day of May 2007."

Defendant (Health System) shall forthwith submit an appeal bond to this Court, as provided by Appellate Rule 17(b). The bond may be in cash or by a written undertaking with good and sufficient surety in the sum of $250.00.

Therefore the case is docketed as of the date of this order's certification. Briefs of the respective parties shall be submitted to this Court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 15(g)(2).
